author: plynch
msg: o sometimes properties fetched using the ${some.property} notation don't always come through. in particular when I added a maven.webserver.port.http calue to my project.properties and ran the plugin, the plugin failed on the check for maven.webserver.test.socket because the ${maven.webserver.test.socket} notation was used. when I switched to context.getVariable('maven.webserver.test.socket') it found my project.properties specified value no problem. Amazing....
o added maven.appserver properties to the filterset so that the two plugins can integrate better.

author: plynch
msg: o in hindsight giving warnings instead of reading the user's mind can slow down ra
pid development. If install is called and already installed, try a reinstall. If s
tart is called and already started, try a restart. Do not give failures in these c

author: plynch
msg: o in hindsight giving warnings instead of reading the user's mind can slow down rapid development. If install is called and already installed, try a reinstall. If start is called and already started, try a restart. Do not give failures in these cases.

author: evenisse
msg: Use torque.sql.dir instead of torque.output.dir for outputDirectory of torque:datasql
